            <table cellpadding="5" style="width:100%">
             <tr>
              <td>
               <img alt="" class="style2" src="images/grads.jpg"/>
              </td>
              <td style="vertical-align:top;">
               <span style="font-size:18px; color:Red; font-weight:bold;">
                REMEMBER...
               </span>
               <br/>
               ...a time when you read the comics instead of the business page?
               <br/>
               ...a time when you thought about who you'd sit next to in lunch, rather than at the meeting?
               <br/>
               ...when a babysitter was someone you were, not someone you hired?
               <p>
                Don't you wish you could get back to those carefree high school days again, even for one night? Why just be nostalgic when you can once again see the people that made your high school days and nights among the most memorable of your life?
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
            </table>
            <table cellpadding="5" style="width:100%">
             <tr>
              <td style="vertical-align:top;">
               <span style="font-size:18px; color:Red; font-weight:bold;">
                REUNIONS UNLIMITED, INC.
               </span>
               can make it happen for you!
               <p>
                REUNIONS UNLIMITED, INC. can handle every aspect of planning and running your high school reunion, from start to finish. You don't have to lay out any  money. You don't have to donate any time at all. You can be as involved or not as involved as you choose to be!
               </p>
               <p>
                And on the night of the party? Your biggest responsibility is to remember the names of the people who sat next to you in math class. We'll handle every other detail. All you have to do is show up and allow yourself to be transported back to the days you remember so well! 
                     You have nothing to do but find the bar, chat with old friends, and let loose!
               </p>
              </td>
              <td style="vertical-align:top;">
               <img src="images/reunion2.jpg"/>
              </td>
             </tr>
            </table>
            For over 30 years, REUNIONS UNLMITED, INC. has planned, organized, and run MORE THAN NINE THOUSAND high school reunions all across the tri-state area. We are the foremost authority in the experience and business of creating a wonderful reunion.
           </td>
          </tr>

              <ul id="ctl00_MainContent_BulletedList1">
               <li>
                Livingston 1978
 Hi Jeanmarie.
 
     First of all, THANK YOU so much for all you did!  I have to tell you how much I appreciate what you did for me.  It meant a lot.
     I can't believe our reunion has come and gone!  How crazy is that!  It is just a moment in time, very fleeting.  You guys did a fantastic job!  Can't thank you enough.  It never would have happened without you.  There is no way any one of us could have done that on our own.  
 
     I think everyone who went had a great time.  I know I did.  There were moments sitting with friend's where it felt like we were still in high school - so wild how that happens.
 
     YES - 50th!  Hope we are all here to celebrate that one!    I may check in on you from time to time.  Hope all is going well for you.  Thank's so much for being there that night.  I think all went very well.  
 
   Hey - it was a successful reunion for the 40th!  
 
 Thanks again Jeanmarie.  So nice finally meeting you in person!
 
 ~ Joni Blush
               </li>
               <li>
                Hi Jeanmarie and Lori,
 
 Don't know how to thank the two of you for everything you did to make our reunion a success. My classmates and their guests were delighted with the entire evening. What seemed to surprise everyone was the food. It was delicious! You were right Jeanmarie when you said you thought the food there was really good.
 
 Laurie, thank you and your husband so much for being there, taking pictures, organizing throughout the evening.....I know that group picture was a challenge, it always is. I thought the room was absolutely perfect, large enough yet intimate. Mike was great too. Had a long interesting conversation with him. Thankfully, he played music but not so loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation. Difficult to catch up with anyone when you can't hear a thing.
 
 You two have certainly turned Reunions Unlimited into an enterprise of which you should be proud. The idea was always a good one and you have made it great. Thank you again.
 
 Don't know that any other reunions are in our future, but if we decide to have one, you can be sure we'll let you know. Wishing you continued success now and in the future.
 
 Warmest regards,
 Kathy
               </li>
